author: Owari Dragon

text: The most fun I've had with a game this year. Nostalgia strings in full effect thanks to its 8-bit nature. I feel like it used the best parts of loved classics like Mega Man, Duck Tales, Castlevania, etc. to make an almost perfect platformer that also feels fresh thanks to more modern mechanics. The base challenge isn't too high, but leaving the choice to the player to make it harder by breaking checkpoints or avoiding to use powerful items is exactly what I like. It helps that it also has my favorite soundtrack of the year, props to Jake and Matsumae. I find this theme quite underrated, it fits perfectly with the haunted halls. Amazing game.
author: SupraDarky

text: Shovel Knight was an amazing game to play. ¬†I also have this as my favorite soundtrack of 2014; to think it's a chiptune soundtrack in 2014 is absolutely amazing. ¬†I'm also that the people at Yacht Club Games were able to have Jake and Manami do the soundtrack for this incredible game. ¬†It is well worth the price in spades.
